column4: is there anyway to install gnome on an ubuntu server, I have tried 'apt-get install gnome' but I get an error
when I try 'apt-get install gnome' the whole error is: 'Package gnome is not available, but is referred to by another package, This may mean the package is missing or etc etc etc
at stefg im just trying to get a desktop environment for my ubuntu srver
sudo aptitude install gnome works here. sudo aptitude install ubuntu-desktop will get some other stuff as well
I tried the first thing you suggested but it didnt work and the second command is still running
it will probably take a while to install
are you running the latest ubuntu version?
it probably didn't work because you have not enabled universe
What would you suggest? I have the 6.06 server disk and thats it
the page ubotu suggested explains how to enable universe. go ahead and do that
ubuntu-desktop is fine. just let it install but you will probably want to enable universe anyway
sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list. back it up first though, in case you screw it up
